job_info.role_description: Design and develop the user interface of web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

soft_skills: Ability to work independently and collaboratively

job_responsibilities: Design and develop the user interface of web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Collaborate with the development team to ensure that the user interface meets the specified requirements and quality standards
Debug and resolve issues in the front-end code, including performance and usability issues
Participate in code reviews and contribute to the development of new features and functionality
Develop and maintain reusable UI components and libraries
Participate in the development and maintenance of the application documentation
Stay current with industry trends and developments in front-end development

questions.question: Your React component fetches user data inside useEffect and stores it in users. While the fetch is in-flight you must render a <Spinner />. Which approach correctly keeps the component from briefly flashing “No users” before the data arrives?
2. A Vue 3 component receives large props that are only read in the template. Which option best prevents unnecessary re-renders while keeping reactivity?

options.text: Destructure props in setup with toRefs.
Mark the component with defineOptions({ immutable: true }).

questions.question: 3. You add a new SCSS partial _mixins.scss to a webpack build that already processes *.scss. Which import guarantees the mixins are available in every component without duplicating them in each file?

options.text: @import '~styles/mixins'; inside main.scss that is entry-loaded by webpack

questions.question: 4. In Cypress you need to assert that a button becomes enabled only after a text field contains at least three characters. Which chain yields the most stable test?
5. A Jest unit test fails with “Cannot find module '@/utils'”. The alias is already declared in webpack. Which single config file update fixes it for Jest without touching webpack?
